revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Anders Holm | image = Anders Holm at 2015 PaleyFest.jpg | alt = Anders Holm at the 2015 PaleyFest | caption = Holm at 2015 [[PaleyFest]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1981|05|29}} | birth_place = [[Evanston, Illinois]], U.S. | nationality = [[Americans|American]] | occupation = [[Comedian]], [[actor]], [[Film producer|producer]], [[Screenwriter|writer]] | alma_mater = [[University of Wisconsin–Madison]] | years_active = 2003–present | spouse = {{marriage|Emma Nesper Holm|2011}} | children = 1 }} '''Anders Holm''' (born May 29, 1981) is an American actor, comedian and writer. He is one of the stars and creators of the [[Comedy Central]] show ''[[Workaholics]]'' and starred in the short-lived [[NBC]] series, ''[[Champions (U.S. TV series)|Champions]].''{{cite news|last1=King|first1=Larry|last2=Holm|first2=Anders|title=Anders Holm on ‘Champions,’ ‘Game Over, Man!’ & Eggplant Emojis (Season 6 Episode 113)|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8jNEOWAHvLI|work=[[Larry King Now]]|date=18 April 2018|format=Video interview}} == Early life and career == Holm was born and grew up in [[Evanston, Illinois]].{{cite news|last1=Wagner|first1=Curt|title=Evanston native Anders Holm teases Season 2 of 'Workaholics'|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/redeye/redeye-anders-holm-interview-workaholics-season-2-20110920-story.html|work=[[Chicago Tribune]]|date=20 September 2011}} Holm graduated from [[Evanston Township High School]]. In 2003, Holm graduated from the [[University of Wisconsin-Madison]] with a bachelor's degree in history. Holm was a member of the swim team there.{{cite news|last1=Bump|first1=Greg|title=Students choose Anders Holm to speak at commencement|url=https://news.wisc.edu/students-choose-anders-holm-to-speak-at-commencement/|work=[[University of Wisconsin–Madison]]|date=16 April 2013}} Holm studied the [[The Second City Training Center|Second City Conservatory]] in Los Angeles.[http://www.mailordercomedy.com/bios.html Bios]. Mail Order Comedy (2011-04-06). Retrieved on 2011-10-19. ==Career== Holm, along with fellow ''Workaholics'' creators [[Blake Anderson]], [[Adam DeVine]] and [[Kyle Newacheck]], formed the sketch comedy group, Mail Order Comedy. Holm played a hip pastor who became Dr. Mindy Lahiri's fiancé in ''[[The Mindy Project]]''.{{cite news|last1=Martin|first1=Denise|title=Anders Holm on Pretend-Dating Mindy Kaling, Godlessness, and Nudity|url=http://www.vulture.com/2013/04/mindy-project-anders-holm-interview.html|work=Vulture|publisher=[[New York (magazine)|New York]]|date=30 April 2013|language=en}} He also made a guest appearance in the fourth season of ''[[Modern Family]]'' in the episode "[[Flip Flop (Modern Family)|Flip Flop]]". Holm made a guest appearance with fellow ''Workaholics'' actors Anderson, DeVine and Erik Griffin on the first episode of the fourth season of ''[[Arrested Development (TV series)|Arrested Development]]''. He has also served as production and head writer's assistant for ''[[Real Time with Bill Maher]]'' before his work on ''Workaholics''.{{cite web| url=http://press.cc.com/series/workaholics/bio/373678| title=About ANDERS HOLM | publisher=Comedy Central| accessdate=January 27, 2015}}{{cite web| url= http://www.fastcocreate.com/3039754/then-and-now/how-workaholics-star-anders-holm-got-busy-writing-tv-shows-and-movies| title=HOW "WORKAHOLICS" STAR ANDERS HOLM GOT BUSY WRITING TV SHOWS AND MOVIES | website = fastcocreate.com| date=January 14, 2015| accessdate=January 27, 2015}} In 2014, Holm starred in the [[Chris Rock]] directed comedy film ''[[Top Five]]''. In 2016, Holm starred in the comedy film ''[[How to Be Single]]''. In June 2016 it was announced that DeVine, Anderson, Holm and Newacheck are working on the film ''[[Game Over, Man!]]'', with [[Seth Rogen]] as producer.{{Cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/workaholics-creators-seth-rogen-team-901191 |title='Workaholics' Creators, Seth Rogen Team for Action Comedy 'Game Over, Man!' |last=Kit |first=Borys |date=June 9, 2016 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}} The film was released on [[Netflix]] on March 23, 2018. ==Personal life== Holm married his college sweetheart, Emma Nesper Holm,{{cite news|last1=Oltuski|first1=Romy|title=#ManCrushMonday: Anders Holm|url=https://www.harpersbazaar.com/culture/features/a15969/anders-holm-interview/|work=[[Harper's Bazaar]]|date=20 June 2016}} in September 2011.{{cite news|last1=Johnson|first1=Brittany|title=Anders Holm: He became a ‘Workaholic’ in Madison |url=https://theweekly.wisc.edu/newsletter/badgers-in-the-world-the-weekly/new-post-for-badgers-in-the-world-the-weekly-2/|work=The Weekly|publisher=[[University of Wisconsin-Madison]]|date=29 August 2012}} Their first child, a boy, was born on December 19, 2013.{{cite news |first=Stephanie |last=Webber |url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-moms/news/anders-holm-workaholics-star-welcomes-baby-boy-with-wife-emma-201481 |title=Anders Holm, Workaholics Star, Welcomes Baby Boy With Wife Emma |newspaper=US magazine |date=January 8, 2014 }} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year !! Title !!
